current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the recognition of the
		  Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina, and for other purposes.

) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended as follows:

text.#text:
By striking the
			 last sentence of the first section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and inserting the following new sections:

text.#text: By striking

Federal recognition is hereby extended to
				the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina, as designated as petitioner number 65 by
				the Office of Federal Acknowledgment. All laws and regulations of the United
				States of general application to Indians and Indian tribes shall apply to the
				Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina and its members.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, may petition under part 83 of title
				25 of the Code of Federal Regulations for acknowledgment of tribal
				existence.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding
				the first section, any group of Indians in Robeson and adjoining counties,
				North Carolina, whose members are not enrolled in the Lumbee Tribe of North
				Carolina as determined under

The Lumbee Tribe of
				North Carolina and its members shall be eligible for all services and benefits
				provided to Indians because of their status as members of a federally
				recognized tribe. For the purposes of the delivery of such services, those
				members of the Tribe residing in Robeson, Cumberland, Hoke, and Scotland
				counties in North Carolina shall be deemed to be residing on or near an Indian
				reservation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of a tribal roll under
, the
and the

shall develop, in consultation
				with the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina, a determination of needs to provide
				the services to which members of the Tribe are eligible. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

shall each submit a
				written statement of such needs to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
after the tribal roll is
				verified.

text.#text: Upon verification by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , define the service population of the Tribe. The

’s
				verification shall be limited to confirming compliance with the membership
				criteria set out in the Tribe’s constitution adopted on November 16, 2001,
				which verification shall be completed within 2 years after the date of the
				enactment of this section.

text.#text:
For purposes of
				the delivery of Federal services, the tribal roll in effect on the date of the
				enactment of this section shall, subject to verification by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may take
				land into trust for the Lumbee Tribe pursuant to this Act. An application to
				take land located within Robeson County, North Carolina, into trust under this
				section shall be treated by the Secretary as an

term.#tail:
trust acquisition under part 151 of title 25, Code of Federal Regulations (or a
				successor regulation).

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or the

text.#text:
The tribe may not
				conduct gaming activities as a matter of claimed inherent authority or under
				the authority of any Federal law, including the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or under any regulations thereunder promulgated by the

text.#text:
The State of North
				Carolina shall exercise jurisdiction over—

all criminal
				offenses that are committed on; and

all civil actions
				that arise on, lands located within the State of North Carolina that are owned
				by, or held in trust by the United States for, the Lumbee Tribe of North
				Carolina, or any dependent Indian community of the Lumbee Tribe of North
				Carolina.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to accept on behalf of the United States, after
				consulting with the

, any transfer by the
				State of North Carolina to the United States of any portion of the jurisdiction
				of the State of North Carolina described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Attorney General of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
pursuant to an
				agreement between the Lumbee Tribe and the State of North Carolina. Such
				transfer of jurisdiction may not take effect until 2 years after the effective
				date of the agreement.

The provisions of
